title: Inside the Micah Parsons trade: How things fell apart in Dallas, and why Green Bay moved quickly
content: Micah Parsons wanted to be a Dallas Cowboy "for life." The disputed nature of a March meeting with Jerry Jones helped chart a course for his exit.

content: Oklahoma State's Mike Gundy and Oregon's Dan Lanning traded barbs Monday after Gundy called attention to the Ducks' sizable budget.

content: Boston's Trevor Story had a strange Fenway Park homer in the sixth inning against Cleveland when the ball went off an outfielder's glove and then the Pesky Pole.

content: Venus Williams and Leylah Fernandez reached the women's doubles quarterfinals at the US Open, defeating the 12th-seeded duo of Ekaterina Alexandrova and Zhang Shuai 6-3, 6-4 in their third-round match Monday.

title: Injured sprinter Thomas won't run at track worlds
content: Olympic champion Gabby Thomas will miss this month's track world championships with an Achilles tendon injury she's been dealing with since May.

content: After losing in the fourth round of the US Open for the second year in a row, this time to Naomi Osaka, Coco Gauff said, "I am not going to let this crush me."

content: Darnold's long NFL journey has led him to the Seahawks, but his transformative year was spent with thwe 49ers.

content: Philadelphia Union's statement win over Cincinnati has the Union back on top of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

content: The 45th edition of the Ryder Cup will take place in September 2025. Check out details on the dates, format, teams, all-time winners and more now.

content: A look at both fighters' best performance, best KO, most dominant fight, the one where they struggled and more.

content: The players you should claim off the waiver wire, including some pitchers to help you in the fantasy playoffs.

title: Another earthquake in 48 hours: After over 1,400 deaths, Afghanistan region jolted again
content: A fresh 5.2 magnitude earthquake rattled eastern Afghanistan on Tuesday, near the epicenter of Sunday's devastating tremor. The recent 6.0 magnitude quake has already claimed over 1,400 lives and left thousands injured. Rescue operations are underway as flattened homes and toppled buildings hinder access to remote areas.

title: BRS suspends K Kavitha: Why KCR removed daughter from party; family feud explained
content: K Kavitha, daughter of K Chandrashekar Rao, has been suspended from the BRS after publicly criticising her cousins, T Harish Rao and Santosh Kumar, for allegedly tarnishing her father's image in connection with the Kaleshwaram project. Weeks before, Kavitha was removed as honorary president of the Telangana Boggu Gani Karmika Sangham. Kavitha said it was a political conspiracy as the internal crisis was deepening.

title: Youngest woman billionaire on leaving college: Parents reaction; money lessons
content: Lucy Guo, the world's youngest self-made billionaire, attributes her early entrepreneurial spirit to her frugal upbringing. Despite her parents' emphasis on academics, she dropped out of Carnegie Mellon to pursue the Thiel Fellowship. Guo's childhood hustles, from selling Pok√©mon cards to creating online gaming tools, laid the foundation for her success with companies like Scale AI and Passes.

title: Who is Brittany Renner? Everything about PJ Washington's ex-girlfriend
content: P.J. Washington, the Dallas Mavericks star, was involved in a heated altercation with his former girlfriend, Brittany Renner, during a custody exchange. The viral video captured Washington's outburst following a remark made by Renner. Renner, a social media personality, fitness model, and influencer, shares a child with Washington, whom she met in early 2020.

title: Steve Jobs last email: He wrote to himself on Apple email ID: Read full message
content: A personal email penned by Steve Jobs a year before his death has resurfaced, offering a rare glimpse into the Apple visionary's reflections. Sent to himself, the email reveals Jobs's profound gratitude for the countless contributions of others that shaped his life. He acknowledged his dependence on humanity, both past and present, for his well-being and existence.

title: Afghanistan earthquake: Death toll crosses 1,400; rescuers scramble for survivors
content: A devastating 6.0 magnitude earthquake in eastern Afghanistan has claimed over 1,400 lives and injured more than 3,100, according to a Taliban government spokesman. The quake, which struck late Sunday, destroyed thousands of homes in Kunar province. Rescue efforts are hampered by difficult terrain.

title: BCCI invites bids to become Indian teams' title sponsors; what's allowed, what's not
content: Following Dream11's exit due to the real money gaming ban, the BCCI seeks a new title sponsor for the Indian cricket team. Bids are invited, excluding companies involved in real money gaming, cryptocurrency, tobacco, and alcohol. The deadline for submissions is September 16.

title: Trademark fight in India: Bombay HC to Cognizant; You cannot use logo till case ends
content: The Bombay High Court has reinstated a ban on Cognizant's use of its logo in India, pending the resolution of a trademark infringement lawsuit filed by Atyati Technologies. This decision overturns a previous order that had allowed Cognizant to continue using the logo.

title: Abuse row: PM Modi‚Äôs emotional outburst against RJD & Congress - 'what did my mother do?'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi responded strongly to alleged abuses against his late mother during a Congress-RJD rally in Bihar, stating it insulted all women. He expressed that the people of Bihar shared his pain and condemned the remarks. Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar also criticized the incident, calling the language used against PM Modi and his mother "utterly deplorable."

title: Discount grows: Russian crude gets even cheaper for India; New Delhi continues to resist US pressure
content: India is facing increased pressure from the US over its growing Russian oil imports, leading to a 50% tariff imposed by the Trump administration. Despite widening discounts on Russian Urals crude, making it cheaper than US alternatives, the US accuses India of funding Russia's war in Ukraine through these purchases.

title: 'Head of anaconda': Ashwin hits out at Lalit Modi over Harbhajan-Sreesanth slapgate video
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has criticized Lalit Modi and Michael Clarke for circulating an old video of the 2008 IPL 'slapgate' incident involving Harbhajan Singh and S. Sreesanth. Ashwin emphasized the importance of moving on from past mistakes, noting that Harbhajan and Sreesanth have already reconciled. The resurfaced footage has been widely condemned, including by Sreesanth's wife, for reigniting a settled controversy.

title: 'Anti-party conduct': BRS suspends K Kavitha - what party said
content: Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) suspended MLC K Kavitha, daughter of KCR, following her public criticism of senior leaders. Kavitha accused T. Harish Rao and J. Santosh Kumar of corruption and tarnishing KCR's image, particularly concerning the Kaleshwaram irrigation project. She alleged their involvement in misdeeds that have defamed her father.

title: Asia Cup: How much do tickets for India vs Pak match cost? How to buy tickets?
content: Asia Cup 2025 ticket sales have officially commenced on Platinumlist, offering fans a chance to secure their seats for the tournament in Dubai and Abu Dhabi. Several package options are available, including group-stage matches, Super Four contests, and the final, alongside individual match tickets. The competition gets underway on September 9.

title: 2020 Delhi riots case: HC rejects bail pleas of Sharjeel Imam, Umar Khalid, 7 others
content: The Delhi High Court has dismissed the bail pleas of Sharjeel Imam, Umar Khalid, and seven others in connection with the 2020 Delhi riots larger conspiracy case. The prosecution argued the violence was a planned conspiracy to defame India, not spontaneous riots.

title: Exclusive | 'I tried to live as a man but': First-ever trans chess player to reach WIM
content: Yosha Iglesias, once a chess prodigy in Sochi, Russia, has made history as the first transgender woman to win the French women's chess championship. Overcoming personal struggles, including a difficult transition and online harassment, Yosha found strength in her chess community and Buddhist philosophy. Her journey, marked by resilience and self-acceptance, inspires others to embrace their true selves.

title: Yamuna threatens Delhi: Floodwaters enter homes; traffic advisory issued
content: The Yamuna River in Delhi has breached the danger mark due to continuous heavy rainfall, leading to waterlogging and flooding in areas like Mayur Vihar. Authorities have closed the Old Iron Bridge and are conducting rescue operations in Burari, evacuating stranded farmers. Shopkeepers in Civil Lines are taking precautions due to rising water levels.

title: 'Put it in container': Pak defence minister‚Äôs solution for floods; calls excess water 'blessing'
content: Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif suggested citizens store floodwater as a blessing amid severe flooding in Punjab province, which has claimed 33 lives and displaced over 700,000 residents. Punjab is experiencing its biggest flood in history, impacting two million people and threatening food security due to crop damage. Monsoon rains have been excessive, leading to widespread devastation across the country.

title: Meet Kittammal V: TN grandma breaking powerlifting records, praised by Anand Mahindra
content: Anand Mahindra lauded Kittammal V, an 82-year-old powerlifter from Tamil Nadu, for her remarkable achievements in state-level competitions. Defying age stereotypes, she inspires many by outperforming younger athletes with her dedication to fitness and a traditional South Indian diet. Her story highlights the importance of resilience and challenges conventional views on aging in India.

title: 'I want my ‚Ä¶': Taylor's interview leaves fans convinced she manifested future with Kelce
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's engagement has fans revisiting a 2012 interview where Swift detailed her vision of love and marriage. Her past words about prioritizing mutual dreams and open communication resonate deeply with her current relationship. Fans are celebrating how her teenage ideals seem to be aligning with her real-life romance with the Kansas City Chiefs star.

title: US Open: Naomi Osaka turns pain into power, fashion into flair at Flushing Meadows
content: Naomi Osaka has lit up the US Open with both style and substance, dazzling in crystal-studded outfits and her quirky ‚Äúlabubus‚Äù plush toys while storming into her first Grand Slam quarter-final in over four years. Defeating Coco Gauff in straight sets, the four-time major champion has embraced motherhood, mental health battles, and a joyful comeback on her beloved Arthur Ashe Stadium.

title: 'One-sided' trade myth: Why Donald Trump is wrong - How US profits big from India
content: Donald Trump's claims of a disastrous trade relationship with India are challenged by a GTRI analysis, revealing a $35-40 billion surplus for the US when considering all earnings. The US benefits significantly from tech, finance, and education sectors in India. India's proposed tariff concessions are generous, and its decisions on oil and defence are based on national interests.

title: PM Modi rides Xi‚Äôs favourite Hongqi during China visit: Here‚Äôs what makes it special
content: The Hongqi L5 draws power from a massive 6.0-litre V12, delivering more than 400 hp. Despite its size, the car manages a 0‚Äì100 km/h sprint in around 8.5 seconds and tops out at nearly 210 km/h.NAt over 5.5 metres long and weighing upward of three tonnes

title: Jitesh Sharma Exclusive: A small-town boy, who keeps and is blooming in finisher's role
content: Jitesh Sharma scored only 261 runs in Royal Challengers Bengaluru's (RCB) title-winning season, but it was not the runs that caught the selectors‚Äô eyes, it was his 176.35 strike rate while batting at 6 and 7. Jitesh, who never had a coach, learnt cricket by watching YouTube videos of his childhood heroes Adam Gilchrist and Sourav Ganguly. Making a comeback into the Indian team at the age of 31 is as breathtaking as his cricketing sojourn.

title: Gurgaon to 'Gurujam': Traffic snarls, broken roads; 10 viral videos capture rain chaos
content: Gurgaon faced chaos on Monday. Heavy rainfall caused roads to submerge. Vehicles stalled, leading to severe traffic jams. Key areas like IFFCO Chowk and Hero Honda Chowk were heavily affected. Commuters experienced hours-long delays. Emergency services struggled to navigate the flooded streets. The city's drainage issues were highlighted once again. Residents are demanding better infrastructure.

title: ‚ÄòIf you arrest us ...': Jarange warns Fadnavis govt; vows to stay till demands met
content: Maratha quota activist Manoj Jarange has warned of intensified protests in Mumbai, with more Marathas expected to arrive over the weekend. Jarange cautioned authorities against arrests or lathi charges, threatening severe consequences. Mumbai Police rejected a renewed request for agitation at Azad Maidan, citing violations and court directives.

title: Semicon India 2025: PM Modi receives first made-in-India chip 'Vikram'
content: Prime Minister Modi received India's first indigenous semiconductor chip, the Vikram processor, at Semicon India 2025. Union IT Minister Vaishnaw highlighted the rapid progress driven by the India Semiconductor Mission, with five units under construction and significant investment committed. Industry leaders praised India's growing role and potential in the global semiconductor market, projecting substantial growth and collaboration.

title: 'They have caused an issue by bringing Gill into T20': Ex India star drops bombshell
content: Robin Uthappa suggests Shubman Gill's selection for the T20I Asia Cup and his vice-captaincy might be influenced by star power and marketing considerations, despite his recent strong Test performance. Uthappa believes that India has a history of backing superstars, and Gill's inclusion aligns with this trend, especially after a successful IPL 2025 season.

title: Rape case: AAP MLA Harmeet Singh Pathanmajra arrested; flees after firing at police
content: Aam Aadmi Party MLA Harmeet Singh Pathanmajra was arrested by Patiala police in connection with a rape case, sparking political turmoil. Pathanmajra claims the arrest is retaliation for criticizing the party's Delhi leadership, alleging they are undermining Punjab leaders and ignoring local issues. He urged supporters to protest, accusing the Delhi leadership of remote-controlling Punjab and punishing dissent.

title: Despite 'economic selfishness': PM Modi hails India's 7.8% GDP growth; takes veiled dig at Trump
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi highlighted India's impressive 7.8% GDP growth, achieved amidst global economic concerns fueled by what he termed "economic selfishness," a likely reference to US trade policies. This statement comes after the US imposed significant tariffs on Indian exports and targeted India's Russian oil purchases, escalating trade tensions between the two nations.

title: Bahrain to open Hajj registration tomorrow: Key details
content: Bahrain will open online registration for the 1447 AH (2026) Hajj season on September 3 via official Hajj platform closing on September 16. Applicants must register through the eKey system, hold a valid ID, and may include four companions. Accepted pilgrims can select campaigns from September 16 and pay BD 150. Health and ID verification are mandatory.

title: 'Designed & made in India': PM Modi on chip mission at Semicon 2025 - top quotes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Semicon India 2025, emphasizing India's ambition to become a semiconductor hub. He received the first made-in-India Vikram 32-bit processor and highlighted the nation's commitment through reforms and investments. Modi envisions India as a key player, designing, manufacturing, and exporting trusted semiconductors globally, driving significant change and economic growth.

title: 'Proposed visit of a VVIP': Is PM Modi heading to violence-hit Manipur on Sept 13? What we know
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is likely to visit Mizoram and Manipur on September 13, as officials said, marking his first visit to Manipur since ethnic tensions escalated in May 2023. In Mizoram, he is expected to inaugurate a railway line connecting Aizawl with Silchar, Assam, as part of the Act East Policy.

title: Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson‚Äôs real estate empire: Inside his lavish mansions
content: Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson owns many luxurious properties. His real estate includes a Beverly Hills mansion with city views. He has a Georgia farm with rustic charm. Johnson also owns a Florida villa for relaxation. These homes show his taste for luxury. The properties reflect his lifestyle and success. Each estate serves a specific purpose for his family and career.

title: ‚ÄúBill Belichick was 41 when Jordon Hudson was 7‚Äù: TCU vs. North Carolina scores go viral
content: Mike Beauvais posted an X post about the age difference between Bill Belichick and Jordon Hudson during a college football game between North Carolina and TCU, but fans quickly corrected his math. The post sparked a flurry of reactions, with users pointing out the actual age gap and commenting on the relationship.

title: 'Shame': Trump trade adviser's fresh attack on India after RIC huddle at SCO; takes jibe at PM Modi
content: Peter Navarro criticized PM Modi for aligning with Putin and Xi Jinping at the SCO summit, urging India to support Europe and Ukraine and cease purchasing Russian oil. He accused India of "profiteering" from refined Russian oil sales and labeled the conflict as "Modi's war." The US has imposed tariffs on India, which New Delhi deems "unjustified."

title: Vote 'chori' row: BJP steps up attack on Congress; claims Pawan Khera has 2 voter ID cards
content: The BJP has accused Congress leader Pawan Khera of possessing two voter ID cards, prompting calls for an Election Commission investigation into potential electoral law violations. This accusation coincides with Rahul Gandhi's intensified criticism of the government, alleging "vote theft" during the recent "Voter Adhikar Yatra" in Bihar.

title: 'Threw India ties aside for Pak business': Ex-US NSA blasts Trump; calls it a 'huge strategic harm'
content: Former NSA Jake Sullivan accuses Donald Trump of prioritizing his family's business interests in Pakistan over strengthening ties with India, calling it a strategic blunder. Sullivan suggests Trump's actions, including potential Bitcoin deals and trade agreements with Pakistan, undermine US credibility and worry allies. He highlights the importance of a strong US-India relationship to counter China.

title: Delhi-NCR rains: Thousands stuck in massive Gurgaon traffic snarl; watch video
content: Gurgaon faced severe traffic disruptions on Monday due to waterlogged roads and numerous vehicle breakdowns. Commuters experienced extensive delays, particularly on the Delhi-Jaipur Expressway and key intersections. The traffic police responded to around 200 distress calls, deploying personnel and cranes to manage the chaos.

title: Gold price prediction today: Rates hit new highs - where are they headed?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are surging, driven by expectations of Federal Reserve rate cuts and geopolitical uncertainties. Spot gold reached $3,475, while MCX October gold hit Rs 104,724. Analysts suggest buying on dips, anticipating a test of the all-time high at $3,500, with potential resistance at $3,650 and support at $3,450.

title: Espionage case: Court extends YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra's judicial custody till Sep 10
content: The Hisar Police previously said no evidence emerged to indicate that Ms. Malhotra had access to any military or defence-related information, but claimed she was in contact with some people

title: Court acquits Professor in 2014 sexual harassment case
content: Investigations revealed that the students had conspired to frame Prof. Viswanathan after they were caught cheating in the examination hall.

title: IIIT Dharwad students win third prize at ISRO Robotic Challenge competition
content: The contest saw the participation of 510 registered universities and institutes, including top IITs and NITs from across the country

title: Cuddalore restaurants too shun Swiggy, Zomato; switch to Tamil Nadu-based food delivery platform Zaaroz
content: Ram Prasath, founder and CEO of Zaaroz said the delivery startup only receives monthly subscriptions from restaurants. Zaaroz is currently operating in over 50 locations (tier 2, tier 3) in Tamil Nadu serving 8 lakh customers.

title: Forest Minister orders probe into activities of ARRS at Agumbe
content: A team of Forest Department officials visited Agumbe Rainforest Research Station at Agumbe in Tirthahalli, to conduct an inquiry into alleged illegal photography of king cobras and the illegal purchase of land

title: ‚ÄòNatural farming benefits farmers with high yields, consumers with chemical-free produce‚Äô
content: Dean of Horticulture College in Bidar S.V. Patil was speaking at a workshop on natural farming at Kamthana village in Bidar district

title: Directorate of Revenue Intelligence imposes ‚Çπ102 crore penalty on Kannada actress Ranya Rao in gold smuggling case
content: ‚ÄúIt was a herculean exercise to prepare a detailed notice along with supporting documents,‚Äù a DRI source said

title: Congress chief asks Centre to provide funds to flood-affected States, says there should not be politics over it
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge says the party shall provide all possible assistance and support to the governments in the States to alleviate the situation for the affected regions

title: Naidu afraid of granting Opposition status to YSRCP, says Sajjala Ramakrishna Reddy
content: He accuses NDA government of betraying people with false promises, mishandling farmers‚Äô issues, and misusing power during elections

title: Opinion: Opinion | To Survive Trump, India Needs More Than Just Handshakes With Xi And Putin
content: The resilience of the Indian economy will outlast Trump's tariff agenda; to survive and flourish beyond that, however, will need more than friendship with Xi and Putin.

title: No Bail To Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam, 7 Others In 2020 Delhi Riots Case
content: The Delhi High Court refused to grant bail to Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam and five others in the 2020 Delhi riots 2020 conspiracy case.

title: Jyotiraditya Scindia's Son Is Youngest Madhya Pradesh Cricket Association Chief
content: Mahanaryaman Scindia, 29, was elected unopposed as the new president of the Madhya Pradesh Cricket Association (MPCA), becoming the youngest to hold the post in the body's 68-year history.

title: 5.2 Earthquake Hits Afghanistan Less Than 48 Hours After 1,400 Died In Quake
content: A 5.2 magnitude earthquake struck Afghanistan less than 48 hours after 1,400 died in one of the country's deadliest quakes.

title: Congress' Pawan Khera Gets Election Commission Notice Over 2 Voter IDs
content: Congress leader Pawan Khera has been issued a notice by the District Election Office in New Delhi for "getting himself registered" in the voter rolls in more than one constituency.

title: Adani Power Gets Coal Ministry Nod To Begin Dhirauli Mine Operations
content: Adani Power on Tuesday said it has received the coal ministry approval to commence mining operations at Dhirauli mine in the Singrauli district, Madhya Pradesh.

title: 1,400 Killed In Afghanistan Earthquake, Rescue Operations Underway
content: A powerful earthquake that struck eastern Afghanistan at the weekend killed more than 1,400 and injured 3,000 others, the Taliban government said Tuesday, making it one of the deadliest to hit the country in decades.

title: In Pics: Heavy Rain, Floods Ravage Parts Of North India
content: Normal life has been severely disrupted in many parts of north India, including Punjab, Haryana, Delhi, Jammu and Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand, due to unprecedented rainfall over the past few days.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Bangladesh Can't Wish Away Its Dependence On India, Even If It Wants To
content: While Pakistan may continue to appeal through symbolic gestures to Bangladeshi identity and play up shared Islamic orientation, India offers tangible developmental dividends that Dhaka requires.

title: India-European Union Trade Deal At "Advanced Stage", Pact With US In Talks: Piyush Goyal
content: Union Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said on Tuesday that the Free Trade Agreement (FTA) negotiations between India and the European Union have reached an advanced stage and that both the parties are making significant progress.

title: Rats Bite 2 Newborns' Fingers, Head, Shoulder Inside Indore Hospital ICU
content: The babies were admitted to the neonatal intensive care unit of the Maharaja Yashwantrao Chikitsalaya (MYH), one of the biggest government hospitals in Madhya Pradesh.

title: Pak Defence Minister Calls Floods A 'Blessing': "Store Water In Tubs"
content: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khwaja Asif has a bizarre solution to tackle Pakistan's flood situation. He wants Pakistanis living in low-lying areas to "store" the flood waters in containers, rather than letting it go to drains.

title: Polish Millionaire's Firm 'Review Bombed' After He Snatched Cap From Child At US Open
content: Polish CEO Piotr Szczerek and his company are at the receiving end of public ire after he was seen snatching a signed hat from a young fan at the US Open.

title: "Colossal Blunder": US Expert On Trump's India Tariffs
content: Leading American international relations expert John Mearsheimer said Donald Trump's secondary tariffs on India for buying Russian oil "won't work."

title: Delhi Woman Quits Government Bank Job, Says "Time To Choose Mental Peace"
content: A 29-year-old Delhi woman, who is also quite active on social media, opened up about quitting her well-paying government job and shared her journey of choosing mental peace over financial stability.

title: "6 Hours For 12 Km": Gurugram Resident Shares Traffic Horror After Rain
content: Speaking about his "nightmare" to NDTV, Shubham Gupta said he left his office in Cyber Hub around 4:30 PM and reached his home in Sector 48 around 10:15 PM.

title: Deepak Mittal, Who Led India-Taliban Talks, Appointed Ambassador To UAE
content: The Ministry of External Affairs has appointed Deepak Mittal as the next Ambassador of India to the United Arab Emirates.

title: Explained: The Vikram-32 Chip Handed Over To PM Modi At Semicon 2025
content: Union Information and Broadcasting Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Tuesday presented India's first indigenously developed Vikram-32-bit chip to Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the inauguration of the Semicon India 2025 conference.

title: Amid US Tariffs, BJP To Launch Swadeshi-Focused Aatmanirbhar Bharat Sankalp Abhiyan
content: BJP will launch a three-month-long 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat Sankalp Abhiyan' from September 25 to December 25, 2025, to promote PM Narendra Modi's vision of Swadeshi amid US President Donald Trump's recent tariff escalation against India.

title: Chlorination drive to continue in Ernakulam district
content: No cases of amoebic meningoencephalitis have been reported in the district so far; most waterbodies have been covered under the two-day mass chlorination campaign

title: Naxalism will be completely eradicated by March next, says Bandi Sanjay Kumar
content: CRPF COBRA unit has played a commendable role in eliminating Naxalism, according to the Union Minister of State for Home Affairs

title: UDF signals non-cooperation with TDB‚Äôs Global Ayyappa Sangamam
content: Leader of the Opposition V. D. Satheesan conveys the Opposition front‚Äôs hardline stance by rebuffing TDB president P.S. Prasanth‚Äôs request for a personal audience at his official residence on Tuesday¬†

title: 35 canines trained in dual skills to help police detect crimes, says A.P. Home Minister
content: Ms. Anitha, along with DGP Harish Kumar Gupta, ADG Intelligence Mahesh Chandra Ladda and other officers participated in the 22nd passing out parade of the canines at APSP 6th Battalion ground in Mangalagiri

title: Acanthamoeba more widespread in Kerala‚Äôs waterbodies than thought earlier
content: In 2013, research by a Regional Institute of Ophthalmology Associate Professor had established that the glut of unhealing corneal ulcers was amoebic keratitis caused by Acanthamoeba and the source of infection was household wells. There are no documented cases of a person with Acanthamoeba keratitis developing meningoencephalitis directly through spread from the eye to the brain

title: Do not panic, fertilizer stocks sufficient in Andhra Pradesh, Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu tells farmers
content: The stocks exceed the demand this season, the Chief Minister asserts, and orders officials to curb black marketing of urea and ensure its uninterrupted supply to the farmers

title: Madras High Court questions man for unleashing pet dog against college students
content: Justice G. Jayachandran imposes stringent conditions for grant of advance bail to a person accused of terrorising women students with his pet dog

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Too little too late: Congress on PM's likely visit to Manipur on September 13
content: Jairam Ramesh pointed out that on August 1, 2023, the Supreme Court said there had been an absolute breakdown of the Constitutional machinery in the State. ‚ÄúYet the Prime Minister remained silent,‚Äù he said

title: Maharashtra issues GR on Hyderabad gazetteer, sets up panel for Kunbi certificates to Marathas
content: The government resolution was issued by the Social Justice and Special Assistance Department in the backdrop of breakthrough in talks between a delegation of Cabinet Ministers and activist Manoj Jarange

title: Amid U.S. tariff hike, ‚ÄòAtmanirbhar Bharat Sankalp Abhiyan‚Äô to be launched in NDA-ruled States
content: The campaign to motivate people to buy locally made goods will begin on September 25, the birth anniversary of Pandit Deen Dayal Upadhyay

title: While rationalising the GST, the Centre must protect States‚Äô revenue receipts, says Tamil Nadu Finance Minister  Thangam Thennarasu
content: He says several projects are being executed in the State after the budgeted funds were allocated,¬†and any major revenue loss will affect their implementation

title: Doctors among five suspended over infant‚Äôs death in Gauhati Medical College
content: Two postgraduate trainees have been rusticated for six months following a report that cited grave misconduct, dereliction of duty, and attempts to manipulate hospital records

title: Madras High Court refers ‚Çπ15 crore dispute between actor Ravi Mohan and production house to arbitral tribunal
content: Second Division Bench of Justices M. Sundar and Mummineni Sudheer Kumar leave it to a retired High Court judge, appointed as sole arbitrator, to take a call on all issues

title: Former Narcotics Control Bureau chief to head CyberPeace Foundation
content: CyberPeace Foundation is a non-profit civil society initiative and think tank advancing digital trust, online safety, and cyber resilience

title: Poll body issues notice to Congress‚Äô Pawan Khera for name in voter list of two constituencies in Delhi
content: According to the notice, Mr. Khera is enrolled as a voter in New Delhi and Jangpura Assembly constituencies.

title: Leopard movement sparks panic in Erode‚Äôs Chennimalai, camera traps installed
content: On September 1, a leopard reportedly swam across the Lower Bhavani Project canal and entered a plantation at Thattankadu near Veppili.

title: MP urges railways to take up developmental works at Nandyal station
content: According to the MP, both Nandyal‚ÄìKurnool and Nandyal‚ÄìRenigunta trains are being operated on the same platform causing severe inconvenience and confusion to passengers as both trains have similar formations

title: Kuthampully‚Äôs handwoven legacy struggles to survive powerloom onslaught
content: Once home to over 1,500 looms, the famed handloom village now counts fewer than 150 weavers, battling low wages, ageing artisans and shrinking state support

title: Re-alignment of political forces likely in Tamil Nadu
content: As the AIADMK general secretary Edappadi Palaniswami has been very firm in not accommodating O. Panneerselvam, T.T.V. Dhinakaran and V. Sasikala,¬†the latest developments have led to the speculation about the possibility of a meeting among the three and AIADMK senior leader K.A. Sengottaiyan.

title: ‚ÄòObjectionable‚Äô cartoons on PM Modi, RSS: SC makes absolute interim protection from arrest granted earlier to Indore cartoonist
content: The top court said the interim protection from arrest earlier granted to cartoonist Hemant Malviya would be made ‚Äúabsolute‚Äù after he tendered an apology for his ‚Äúobjectionable‚Äù social media posts

title: Upset AIADMK leader Sengottaiyan to speak ‚Äòopenly‚Äô on September 5
content: The rift between the senior leader and AIADMK general secretary Edappadi K. Palaniswami has been apparent for several months.

title: Tension near Kattupalli port as agitating contract workers pelt stones at police
content: Police resorted to lathi charge and shot tear gas shells. The commotion began when the contractual labourers engaged by a ship building firm demanded compensation for a colleague who died after an accidental fall.

title: Nara Lokesh opens advanced smart kitchen at Kadapa
content: The Minister also announced to take the number of smart kitchens in the district to 33 in eleven mandals by December, which will be able to provide sumptuous meal every day to 1.24 lakh children across Kadapa district

title: YS Sharmila pays tribute at YSR Samadhi on death anniversary of her father and former Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh
content: She also paid rich tributes to the families of the 700 persons who died of shock in the aftermath of the demise of their favourite leader

title: Allahabad High Court raises concern over safety of women in gyms
content: Court questions male trainers‚Äô role, directs police to verify registration and staffing of fitness centre

title: Super Six Super Hit meet on September 10 on the outskirts of Anantapur
content: Nearly 3.5 lakh people are expected to attend the meeting with majority of them being women, Minister for Finance Payyavula Keshav said

title: Malayalam movie Lokah faces Karnataka‚Äôs ire: Makers issue apology, to remove ‚Äúoffensive dialogue‚Äù
content: Social media users had expressed anger at the film‚Äôs protrayal of Bengaluru as a ‚Äòhub of parties and drugs‚Äô and also demanded removal of certain dialogues and scenes which ‚Äúdemean girls‚Äù

title: Congress is ‚Äòquintessential vote chor‚Äô, EC must probe how Rahul‚Äôs ‚Äòclose associate‚Äô carries 2 voter IDs: BJP
content: The BJP spokesperson also asked Mr. Gandhi if he would take any action against Mr. Khera for possessing multiple voter IDs

title: KCR suspends daughter Kavitha from BRS for ‚Äòanti-party activities‚Äô
content: The action comes a day after Ms. Kavitha levelled serious allegations against her party colleagues and close relatives ‚Äì former Irrigation Minister Harish Rao and former MP Santosh Kumar

title: DMK government crippled Cauvery-Gundar river-linking project: Palaniswami
content: Despite increased borrowings and higher revenue, no project has been implemented by ruling party, he charged

title: Kerala Governor moves Supreme Court against Kerala Chief Minister‚Äôs role in Kerala VC appointments
content: Kerala Governor Rajendra Arlekar cites UGC regulations; says rules vests authority to pick VC from search panel names to Chancellor/Governor

title: PM Modi hits out at RJD, Congress over remarks against his mother
content: Prime Minister says insult extends to women of Bihar; accuses RJD of shielding criminals during its rule

title: BDA seeks exemption from RERA provisions, cites special statute and welfare role in Bengaluru housing sector
content: The authority further argued that the BDA Act, 1976, is a special statute, while RERA is a general law applicable to the real estate sector. As per settled legal principles, a special statute prevails over a general one. Therefore, the provisions of RERA cannot override those of the BDA Act

title: When Anna University banned American beverages Pepsi, Coca-Cola from its canteen 22 years ago
content: The Lovely Professional University (LPU) in Punjab recently announced a ban on American soft drinks in the varsity campus. Way back in 2003, a state university in Tamil Nadu banished Pepsi and Coca-Cola from its canteen.

title: Watch: Denied Aadhaar, Pune tribal community can‚Äôt access schools or hospitals
content: A number of people from tribal communities across Maharashtra face barriers to accessing education, health care, and government schemes because they are not registered with the Unique Identification Authority of India

title: Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam bail plea hearing LIVE: ‚ÄòAll the appeals are dismissed,‚Äô says Delhi High Court
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, on July 9, 2025, told the Delhi High Court that those accused of acting against the nation must remain in jail until they are either convicted or acquitted

title: Giants recall Teng to face Rockies
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the nationals are slated to call up Andrew Alvarez to start against the marlins . alvarez posted a 3.95 ERA and 1.35 WHIP as a starter .

title: College football Power Rankings: First impressions of each Top 25 team
content: first impressions can be deceiving -- shoutout to Kenny Trill and a magical night in 2014 -- but they also provide much-yearned-for context to the power rankings . some could be a harbinger for big things ahead, like Florida State steamrolling Alabama following a 2-10 season in 2024 .

title: Stafford embarking on Year 17, will he - and his back - make the most of it?
content: quarterback's back soreness isn't impacting his expectations for the Rams, coach says . he is entering his fifth season in los angeles . the team is hoping to host the Houston Texans to open the season on sunday .

title: Mid-air scare: Suspected bird hit on IndiGo Nagpur-Kolkata flight; probe under way
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Only in college football: Week 1's best non-statistical superlatives
content: the legendary Lee Corso picks Ohio State to win in his final "College GameDay" opening weekend always delivers a little bit of everything that makes fans say, "Only in college football" a mascot lost its head (literally) and a storybook tribute was delivered .

title: Son's LAFC arrival brings out pride in L.A.'s Korean community
content: Son Heung-Min welcomes son to your new home . despite a tense 2-1 loss to San Diego FC, the result felt secondary to the raucous festivities . the south Korean forward represents much more than just a player on the pitch .

title: Bolts' Harris cleared for contact, expects to play
content: new: "it's probably my fifth day at practice," he says . new: he expects to play in the Chargers' season opener against the Kansas City Chiefs . he missed all of training camp because of an eye injury he sustained in a fireworks mishap . "there's a possibility," says a coach .

title: Week 1 takeaways: What happened to Arch Manning? Is Utah the Big 12 team to beat?
content: our college football experts break down key takeaways from week 1 performances . the college football playoff selection committee will continue to use schedule strength to evaluate teams . if they do, that could be a problem for Alabama, Texas and Clemson .
